results.title: Melbourne
results.brief_description:
Unedited footage of Melbourne including people relaxing in a ‘garden’ in the city. Odd moment halfway through where an Aboriginal man (Jagajaga?) signs his name on an official-looking document

Contains an excellent ‘The End’ that features a watercolour image of Melbourne city overlooking the Yarra and towards St. Paul’s Cathederal.

results.title: A Dairyland Romance
results.creator_credit: Victoria. Dept. of Agriculture, Jack Keane and Keith Harrison
results.brief_description:
Story revolves around the importance of choosing breeding partners that have good breeding themselves and the benefits that this will bring their offspring. It stars two cows with human characteristics (standing on two legs, wearing clothes, speaking english, etc.) being interviewed about their successful partnership together and goes on to give information on correct rearing techniques. Hand-painted animation looks suberb and the deadpan delivery of the main charcaters is very amusing.

Illustrated ‘The End’ and opening titles.

results.title: Cinema
results.brief_description: Sebastian C. Schroeder’s sublime 1973 film ‘Cinema’, takes the physicality of film itself as a site of transformation, as celluloid itself metamorphoses into a magical realm for a group of Afghani children.
results.description: Sebastian C. Schroeder’s sublime 1973 film ‘Cinema’, takes the physicality of film itself as a site of transformation, as celluloid itself metamorphoses into a magical realm for a group of Afghani children.

results.title: Tidal vectors
results.brief_description: ‘Tidal Vectors’ is a 3D digital installation of the dynamic shape and motion of Sydney Harbour composed from scientific data of depth soundings and tidal flow vectors. Elements of marine geography and historical reference relating to the harbour are layered to create a poetic metaphor for Sydney and the broader Australian Culture.

results.title: Free radicals
results.brief_description:
A primitive kinetic dance of white lines and angles meticulously scratched onto black and white film over an 8 month period and then edited and retrospectively matched with an African field tape of the Bagirmi tribe. The title is a reference to modern physics, ‘free radicals’ being particles of energy. The original version was a major award winner at the Experimental Film Competition at the 1958 Brussels World Fair. This revised version was a reworking of the
original by Lye in 1979, with financial assistance from
the New Zealand Film Commission. He deleted approximately 1 min. from his first version, made in 1958.

results.title: Green Fingers: Weed Control
results.brief_description: ‘Green Fingers’ was a series of short instructional films on home gardening tips, produced by the Victorian Department of Agriculture. In this episode, ‘Weed Control’, gardener Rod Cantrill demonstrates how to control weeds in the home garden. Cantrill shows a range of methods for managing weeds, including hoeing, mulching and herbicides, accompanied by a narrator who explains the benefits and correct techniques of each method. The episodes of ‘Green Fingers’ are an early example of popular gardening shows in the tradition of ‘Sow What’, ‘Better Homes and Gardens’, and ‘Gardening Australia’.
